bill_title: protect an employee's pay check by requiring prior written authorization to collect fees for political activity.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to protect an employee's pay check by limiting employee organization dues to the support of the basic activities of the employee organization. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Employee organization dues are limited to activities necessary to perform the basic duties of the employee organization in dealing with the employer. The basic duties of the employee organization supported by dues are limited to collective bargaining, contract administration, or grievance resolution. Section 2. Each employee organization shall report its income from dues, fees, and other payments and its expenses to the Department of Labor annually. Each employee organization shall report its income and expenses in sufficient detail as necessary to allow a member of the employee organization represented by that organization or other interested person to determine if the organization's income and expenses were necessary to perform its basic duties as an employee organization. Section 3. An employee organization may collect from any person a fee or other payment that can be used for any activity if the employee organization has received a separate, prior written authorization from the person for each activity. The authorization remains in effect until revoked and it may be revoked at any time upon written notice. Section 4. An employee organization may collect from any person a fee or other payment that can be used for political activity if the employee organization has received a separate, prior written authorization from the person for the political activity. The authorization remains in effect until revoked and it may be revoked at any time upon written notice.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to protect an employee's pay check by requiring prior written authorization to collect fees for political activity. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. An employee or labor organization governed by chapter 3-18 or 60-9 may collect from any person a fee or other payment that can be used for political activity if the employee or labor organization has received a separate, prior written authorization from the person for the political activity. The authorization remains in effect until revoked and it may be revoked at any time upon written notice. Political activity is activity supported by a contribution or expenditure as those terms are used in 2 U.S.C. § 441(b) as in effect January 1, 1999. Political activity also includes providing contributions to political parties, candidates, political action committees, or participating or intervening in any political campaign or political party. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to protect an employee's pay check by requiring prior written authorization to collect fees for political activity. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. An organization governed by chapter 3-18 or 60-9 and recognized as the exclusive representative of an employee unit may collect from any person a fee or other payment that can be used for political activity if the organization has received a separate, prior written authorization from the person for political activity. The authorization remains in effect until revoked and it may be revoked at any time upon written notice. Section 2. Any member of an organization as of the effective date of this Act is deemed to have been given notice and to have authorized political activity if the organization issues information on a periodic basis detailing the activity. A periodic basis is not less than four times per year. This section does not apply to any political party. Section 3. For the purposes of this Act, the term, political activity, means any contribution, expenditure, or valuable consideration in whatever form: (1) To a candidate, candidate's committee, political party committee, ballot question committee, or political action committee; (2) In furtherance of or to defeat the nomination of any person as a candidate for public office or the election of any person to public office; or (3) In furtherance of or to defeat any constitutional amendment, initiated measure, referred law, or other question submitted to the voters of the whole state. The term does not include lobbying. BILL HISTORY 2/1/99 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 286 2/2/99 Referred to Commerce.
